config.name: Maricruz Johal
config.profile_info: After 27 years in the industry writing C#, JavaScript, and Python, I’ve debugged enough late night code to know exactly where students get stuck. I’m here to fast track your learning with practical, real-world examples. My goal is to help you move from frustration to functionality. Let's get to work.

projects.title: The Gym Planning App
projects.description:
This application allows the user plan future workouts. The workout planning application provides the following functionality:
1. Login using YouTube account
2. Add exercises including title, image links, video links, and description.
3. Allows the user to select a calendar date and exercises, including reps, sets and max-weight for that date.
4. Provide a list of upcoming planned workout instances.
5. Provides functionality to flag each planned exercise as completed. 
6. Display the number of completed workouts on the dashboard for that user.

projects.title: API Playground
projects.description:
This application implements 3 free APIs
1. Advice Slip API - The Advice Slip JSON API is provided for free. 😎 It currently gives out over 10 million pieces of advice every year.
2. Giphy API - By integrating with GIPHY, the first and largest GIF search engine, you gain access to our ever-growing content library of GIFs and Stickers.
3. BoredAPI - Find random activities to fight boredom

projects.title: Jeep Social Media
projects.description:
This is a Social Media app for Jeep offroad enthusiasts.
1. This app implements the JSONPlaceholder API - A reliable API for testing and prototyping. JSONPlaceholder is a free online REST API that can be used whenever fake data is needed.  This includes posts, comments, albums, photos, todos, and user.
2. The Jeep Social Media app includes functionality to add a post, view a feed, view member profiles, and view comments.
